Description: Papyrus; thirty-one lines of Hieratic epistolary text;Late Ramesside Letter no. 28, from Butehamun to Piankh, informing the general why his orders have not been carried out.
Curator's comments: Text: Cerny, LRL, no 28. Translation: Wente, LRL, 59-65; Wente, Letters from Ancient Egypt, 194-5. Janssen, LRL and Communications, HPBM VI, pl. 39-40. Part, with comments: Reeves & Wilkinson, The Complete Valley of the Kings, 204-5; N. Strudwick, Masterpieces of Ancient Egypt, London 2006, pp. 238-9.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (139333) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/139333)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus Black ink Displayed in Room 62 until 1992 Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: copydex self adhesive carpet tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: fair (incomplete - fragmentary)
Acquisition notes: Bears the label 'Salt 238'. This number does not apparently relate to either mss lists or the 1835 sale.
